/hr/registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicharts-m.doc: metallb is a load-balancer implementation for Kubernetes, allowing you to create services with type: LoadBalancer. With BGP, you can setup IP ranges in your network that get assigned to k8s services. You can use IP addresses that are assigned to you, and share them amongst services.

0: Modern UI for Ansible, Terraform/OpenTofu, Bash and Pulumi

1: until nc -w 1 -v $POSTGRES_HOST:5432; do echo "Waiting for database"; done

/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-exte.title: external-dns helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-exte.name: external-dns
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-exte.doc: ExternalDNS is a Kubernetes add-on that automatically manages the creation and updates of DNS records for services running in your cluster. It integrates with a variety of DNS providers, such as CloudFlare DNS, Amazon Route 53, Google Cloud DNS, and more, to ensure that your applications are easily accessible from anywhere with a DNS name. With ExternalDNS, you can simplify the process of managing DNS records for your home lab, eliminating the need for manual updates and reducing the risk of errors.

/hr/stevehipwell.github.io-helm-charts-t.title: thanos helm release
/hr/stevehipwell.github.io-helm-charts-t.name: thanos

0:
groups:
  - name: PrometheusWatcher
    rules:
      - alert: PrometheusDown
        annotations:
          summary: A Prometheus has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery
        expr: absent(up{job="kube-prometheus-stack-prometheus"})
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: critical
1:
groups:
  - name: PrometheusWatcher
    rules:
      - alert: PrometheusDown
        annotations:
          summary: A Prometheus has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery
        expr: absent(up{job="kube-prometheus-stack-prometheus"})
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: critical

/hr/stevehipwell.github.io-helm-charts-t.doc: Thanos is an open-source project that provides a highly available and horizontally scalable way to store and query time-series data in a Kubernetes cluster. It integrates with popular time-series databases, such as Prometheus, to provide a unified view of your monitoring and logging data. Thanos also provides features such as data compression and deduplication, making it an efficient solution for storing large amounts of time-series data. With Thanos, you can easily store, query, and analyze your home lab's monitoring and logging data, providing valuable insights into the performance and health of your applications.

1:
provider = "google"
auth_logging = true
cookie_domains = ".${FAMILY_DOMAIN}"
cookie_httponly = true
cookie_name = "_john_family_oauth"
cookie_refresh = "1h"
cookie_samesite = "lax"
cookie_secure = true
email_domains = [ "${FAMILY_DOMAIN}" ]
pass_access_token = true
pass_authorization_header = true
pass_basic_auth = false
request_logging = true
session_store_type = "cookie"
silence_ping_logging = true
set_authorization_header = true
set_xauthrequest = true
skip_jwt_bearer_tokens = true
skip_provider_button = true
ssl_insecure_skip_verify = false
standard_logging = true
upstreams = [ "static://200" ]
whitelist_domains = ".${FAMILY_DOMAIN}"
footer = "For Internal Family Use Only"
reverse_proxy = "true"
redirect_url = "https://sso.${FAMILY_DOMAIN}/oauth2/callback"
